revision.comment: tweaks/corrections + remove flags from infobox per [[WP:INFOBOXFLAG]]
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=April 2012}} {{Infobox military person |name= Sir Rex Roe |image= |caption= |nickname= |birth_date= {{birth date|1925|05|04|df=yes}} |birth_place= |death_date= {{death date and age|2002|11|03|1925|05|04|df=yes}} |death_place= |placeofburial= |allegiance= United Kingdom |branch= [[Royal Air Force]] |serviceyears= 1943–81 |rank= [[Air Chief Marshal]] |unit= |commands= [[Air Member for Supply and Organisation]] (1978–81)
[[RAF Support Command|Support Command]] (1977–78)
[[RAF Training Command|Training Command]] (1976–77)
[[RAF Syerston]] (1967–69)
[[No. 204 Squadron RAF|No. 204 Squadron]] (1960–62) |battles= [[Second World War]] |awards= [[Knight Grand Cross of the Order of the Bath]]
[[Air Force Cross (United Kingdom)|Air Force Cross]]
[[Queen's Commendation for Valuable Service in the Air]] (2) |relations= |laterwork= }} [[Air Chief Marshal]] '''Sir Rex David Roe''', {{postnominals|country=GBR|size=100%|sep=,|GCB|AFC}} (4 May 1925 – 3 November 2002) was a senior [[Royal Air Force]] commander. ==RAF career== Educated at the [[City of London School]] and the [[University of London]], Roe joined the Royal Air Force in 1943 during the [[Second World War]].Debrett's People of Today 1994 He was appointed [[Officer Commanding]] [[No. 204 Squadron RAF|No. 204 Squadron]] in 1960 and became Senior Air Staff Officer at Headquarters [[No. 18 Group RAF|No. 18 Group]] in 1964.[http://www.rafweb.org/Biographies/Roe_RD.htm Air of Authority – A History of RAF Organisation – Air Chief Marshal Sir Rex Roe] He went on to be Station Commander at [[RAF Syerston]] in 1967, Director of RAF Flying Training in 1969 and Deputy Controller, Aircraft at the [[MoD Procurement Executive]] in 1972. After that he was made Senior Air Staff Officer at Headquarters [[Near East Air Force (Royal Air Force)|Near East Air Force]] in 1974. He was made Air Officer Commanding-in-Chief at [[RAF Training Command]] in January 1976 and personally took delivery of the new [[BAE Hawk|Hawk]] in November of that year flying it himself into [[RAF Valley]].[http://myweb.tiscali.co.uk/hawkerassociation/hanewsletters/hanewsletterpdf/hanewsletter013.pdf Hawk – First Delivery] The Hawker Association newsletter, No. 13 Summer 2006 His last appointments were as Air Officer Commanding-in-Chief at [[RAF Support Command]] in 1977 and as [[Air Member for Supply and Organisation]] in 1978 before he retired in 1981. ==References== {{reflist|30em}} {{s-start}} {{s-mil}} {{succession box|title=Commander-in-Chief [[RAF Training Command|Training Command]]| before=[[Neville Stack|Sir Neville Stack]]| after=Post disbanded| years=1976–1977}} |- {{succession box|title=Commander-in-Chief [[RAF Support Command|Support Command]]| before=[[Reginald Harland|Sir Reginald Harland]]| after=[[Keith Williamson|Sir Keith Williamson]]| years=1977–1978}} |- {{s-bef|before=[[John Nicholls (RAF officer)|Sir John Nicholls]]}} {{s-ttl|title={{nowrap|[[Air Member for Supply and Organisation]]}}|years=1978–1981}} {{s-aft|after=[[John Rogers (RAF officer)|Sir John Rogers]]}} {{s-end}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Roe, Rex}} [[Category:1925 births]] [[Category:2002 deaths]] [[Category:People educated at the City of London School]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of London]] [[Category:Royal Air Force air marshals]] [[Category:Knights Grand Cross of the Order of the Bath]] [[Category:Recipients of the Air Force Cross (United Kingdom)]] [[Category:Recipients of the Commendation for Valuable Service]]
